column4: Can someone help me? Apparently I have 4 "Primary" partitions, and there is 17 Gigs of unallocated space, I want to move the unallocated space to a diff partition.
well cant i just remake the swap after?
yes swap would be easiest to delete then remake
you resize a partition which is adjacent to the unallocated
yes you have to potentially slide (move) other partitions to get it where it's needed
the extended thing is the way to have more than 4 partitions
how would i go about making it so that my windows XP and storage drive are inside it? (right now there is only my storage drive)
you can have at max 4 primary partitions, so the "extended" container was created which can hold more partitions (called logical partitions)
actually, everything can generally be logical... but windows usually demands to be a primary partition
yea thats cool you can do that, how would i move the win xp partition into the sub partition?
I don't think windows will boot if it were logical, also I don't think believe you can convert..
what do you have now and what do you want to resize? could you pastebin the output of 'sudo parted /dev/sda print' and I'll take a look
well i dont have IRC on LIVE
sda2 (which is extended) with only one thing under it (sda5 --> storeage)
it's hard to tell you what to do without understanding your physical setup
